column4: hi everyone.. "according to mtab this drive is already mounted" but i still cannot access my data, anyone know why this happens?
where is it mounted?  what permissions are on the mount point?
it is mounted in /media/Drivename and i just set chmod 777 on it
i can cd to the path /media/Eigenschaften no error message
k, so what doesn't work exactly?
notice that the 777 permissions apply only to /media/Eigenschaften, not the stuff under it
wasnt thers something like chmod 777 * or so to apply it to subfolders?
are you sure that is what you want?
yes, im the only user of this pc
sudo chmod -R 777 /media/Eigenschaften   (if you apply this to the wrong place, your install will be broken)
its a storage drive, should be safe to do that right?

just another question if u dont mind... since this is an internal drive, i want it to mount on startup, but that didnt work with this line in fstab "/dev/hdb1  /media/Eigenschaften  ext3  rw,defaults,umask=0000  0  2"
and when i replaced /dev.. with the UUID it also didnt work
ext3 does not use the umask option
